intro: Tulasnea lawii, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to Mexico and is characterized by its showy, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Tulasnea lawii thrives in warm, sunny climates and requires well-drained soil. It is also valued for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
